image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The parents of conjoined twins in PNG who were hoping to send their babies to Sydney for an operation are now trying to go to Germany instead because Australia is too expensive

title.children: Hopes for German miracle as conjoined twins priced out of Sydney surgery

image.altText: A woman sits inside a room with a lamp in background, smiling at camera.

props.synopsis: Older Australians were promised "a world class aged care system", but as "once in a generation" changes roll out, some feel they are being delivered anything but.

title.children: New aged care reforms roll out leaving some 'shocked' by their new fees

image.altText: Dark, stormy clouds gather over an outback road at Moulamein in NSW

title.children: 'Very dangerous' supercell storms could bring potential tornadoes, giant hail

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: And until someone â€” redundant workers, big business, the RBA or government â€” foots the bill, interest rates are unlikely to budge from here.Â

title.children: Why interest rates will not fall again until someone pays the price

image.altText: Prince Andrew and his former wife Sarah Ferguson in 2025

title.children: Prince Andrew hasn't had a paid job but he's managed to fund a luxury lifestyle

image.altText: Three 18 year old girls stand next to the window in the building of a modern corridor

title.children: Students left with more questions than answers after school exam fiasco

image.altText: Denmark pram

props.synopsis: This is not the first revelation about how we treat the most vulnerable in our society but such reports persistently reveal a deeper, and more distressing malaise about Australian society.

title.children: It's become clichÃ© to turn to Scandinavia for answers but sometimes we must

image.altText: A mushroom cloud from a nuclear weapons test in a desert.

props.synopsis: The US has not conducted nuclear weapons testing for 33 years. Now Donald Trump is calling for a resumption, raising concerns about what that may involve.Â

title.children: Trump wants the US to resume nuclear weapons testing. This is what it could mean

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese smiling.

props.synopsis: The PM and his government are sitting in the often-fleeting sweet spot that comes early in the second term under our Westminster system of government.

title.children: Spectres of stagflation and soaring bills haunt Albanese's salad days

image.altText: A glass vial full of white powder sitting next to a petri dish of dark grey ore.

title.children: True cost of critical minerals becomes clearer amid chase for holy grail

image.altText: Sold signs real estate Sydney

props.synopsis: NSW sees a 16.8 per cent increase in new property listings during spring â€” ringing true to the age-old saying this time of year is the best time to jump into the housing market.

title.children: Why spring sends buyers into overdrive in the property market

image.altText: Queensland Police generic 2025-06-23 10:06:00

props.synopsis: A teenage boy has died overnight after falling from an e-bike in Broadbeach. It comes just days after an eight-year-old was killed in an e-bike collision on the Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Second e-bike fatality in three days as teenager dies on Gold Coast

image.altText: A man wearing a yellow shirt speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Cricketer Usman Khawaja is one of the highest-profile Australian athletes who regularly wades into political issues. Now, Khawaja and other athletes have agreed to form a Players' Coalition to influence policy change on issues ranging from racism and human rights to social media abuse.Â

title.children: Khawaja has seen politicians 'all over cricket', now he's joining other athletes for action

image.altText: whispering woman

props.synopsis: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: Brutal weather, a prince evicted, gen alpha slang and nature being weird â€¦ again

image.altText: Three authors pictured in front of their book covers, on a green background

props.synopsis: 'Spiky characters' and 'luminous writing': Here's what we thought of the prestigious literary award's 2025 shortlist, the first with Sarah Jessica Parker as judge.

title.children: Book experts dish on the snubs and surprises in the Booker Prize shortlist

image.altText: A man in a dark-blue shirt stands in the middle of a winery with bottles light up on the walls.

props.synopsis: From wine in 187ml bottles to spirits in sleek aluminium cans, producers are downsizing to meet a growing demand for convenience and variety.

title.children: Alcohol industry explores smaller packaging for 'promiscuous' customers

image.altText: A slightly run-down wood panel house with a neatly mown lawn.

props.synopsis: The median house price in regional Victoria is $636,500. But what that will get you can look very different from place to place.

title.children: What does the average house price get you in regional Victoria?

image.altText: A tropical island with smaller islands in the distance.

props.synopsis: Suzanne Rees joined a hike on Queensland's Lizard Island as part of a cruise stopover. She would never make it back to the boat.

title.children: Inside the tropical island cruise that ended in tragedy

image.altText: An older woman with glasses looks sad, looking past the camera.

props.synopsis: Widespread farm crime is frustrating rural communities, with almost 90 per cent of farmers in New South Wales reporting they have been victims.Â

title.children: Farmers fight theft, trespass, arson. Survey shows how bad it has become

image.altText: Leanne Castley in the Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: After suspending two backbenchers from her party room this week, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has been silent. And it's hard to see how staying silent is helping Canberrans build trust in her party and her as the ACT's alternative chief minister.

title.children: Silence from Canberra Liberals leader only making a bad situation worse

image.altText: High Court exterior

props.synopsis: Human rights lawyers have applied to intervene in the High Court case of a man facing deportation to Nauru, arguing the government should be barred from deporting people to places where they face death or serious harm.

title.children: Lawyers launch bid to intervene in case of man facing deportation to Nauru

image.altText: Woman stands with a sewing machine

props.synopsis: Migrant and refugee women often struggle to find employment upon arriving in Australia, even if they have experience and qualifications. A 14-week program is trying to help.

title.children: Areej has a master's degree, but she's had to 'start from scratch' in Australia

image.altText: An illustration of the silhouette of two people wearing sling and bandage behind a bag of fruits and vegetables.

props.synopsis: Many young people on the Working and Holiday Visa programs come to Australia to fill labour shortages in industries like meat processing and farming, but there are concerns around their health and safety in dangerous workplaces.Â

title.children: Holiday workers risking injury so Australians can get meat

image.altText: Black and white photo of a woman lying in between two halves of a wooden box, a magician in a tuxedo leaning over her

props.synopsis: From rabbits in hats to women being sawn in half, magic has captivated the imaginations of generations of Australians. Thanks to one "certified fanboy", we have that history at our fingertips.

title.children: Why are women always the ones being sawn in half in magic shows?

image.altText: Man in suit and tie surrounded by journalists.

props.synopsis: Dutch centrist party D66 is now expected to take the lead in a first round of talks to form a coalition government.

title.children: Dutch centrist leader Rob Jetten claims 'historic' win in Netherlands election

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: The head of the National Anti-Corruption Commission will step away from all defence-related corruption referrals following questions over his handling of perceived conflicts of interest.

title.children: National anti-corruption chief steps away from all defence investigations

image.altText: A woman sits at her desk with her laptop.

props.synopsis: Patients are calling for better access to long COVID care after the closure of one of the country's last public clinics.

title.children: Long COVID patients seeking help 'let down by the system'

image.altText: Man holding rainbow flag while standing outside

props.synopsis: A Queensland trans man says healthcare workers did not fully understand his needs when he sought fertility treatment.Â

title.children: Why being trans in regional Australia means higher healthcare hurdles

image.altText: An over the shoulder shot of two women looking at an old letter.

props.synopsis: Sixty years ago in Canada, 12-year-old Diane Hatt went searching for a pen pal in Australia. She found one in South Australian Joy Doevendans and they've become best friends.

title.children: Pen pals for 60 years, Joy and Diane live on opposite sides of the world

image.altText: Jamaican men walking past large piles of debris and the collapsed roofs of destroyed homes

props.synopsis: The death toll in the wake of Hurricane Melissa has climbed to at least 49, according to official reports, after wreaking destruction across much of the northern Caribbean.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa death toll rises to at least 49 as clean-up continues

image.altText: A man in a wide brim hat and sunglasses has a guitar strapped on and leans against a car

props.synopsis: From indie rock to children's TV icon, David McCormack has done it all â€” and now he's back with a new album and zero expectations.

title.children: David McCormack on the power of pop music and the beauty of Bluey

image.altText: Front of historic home

props.synopsis: In Tasmania's southern midlands, Alan Townsend has spent the past two decades restoring an agricultural homestead with a history that dates back to the 1800s. This weekend, its doors will be open for people to visit.

title.children: Open House southern midlands allows glimpse into farmer's life in 1800s

image.altText: Alex De Minaur looks skyward in frustration during a match

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur suffers another nightmarish defeat in Paris at the hands of his old tormentor Alexander Bublik.

title.children: De Minaur upset by familiar foe again in Paris
